creator: cap@informatik.uni-rostock.de
text:
I had Apache 2.0.54 installed and realized this would pose problems with Twiki.
So I uninstalled the otherwise working 2.0.54 plus ssl and tried to install 1.3.33.

Since this time I am no longer able to install just ANY version of Apache.

The installer complains with the well known interruption message. Looking at the
installer logs it is always a complaint on an existing service. Interesting
enough, the registry key mentioned below is NOT existant in the registry. 

Action 1:29:25: AppSearch. Searching for installed applications
AppSearch: Property: EXISTING_APACHE_SERVICE_PATH, Signature: ExistingApacheService
MSI (c) (AC:08): Note: 1: 2262 2: Signature 3: -2147287038 
MSI (c) (AC:08): Note: 1: 2262 2: CompLocator 3: -2147287038 
MSI (c) (AC:08): Note: 1: 1402 2:
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Apache2 3: 2 
MSI (c) (AC:08): Note: 1: 2262 2: IniLocator 3: -2147287038 
MSI (c) (AC:08): Note: 1: 2262 2: DrLocator 3: -2147287038 
Action ended 1:29:25: AppSearch. Return value 1.

I assume that this is the problem, but I do not see how the installer STILL gets
the idea that recently an Apache was installed. 

Yes, I did an uninstall.
Yes, I cleared all registry values.
Yes, I searched the file system for remaining files.
Yes, I did try several Win XP system restores.
Yes, I did try different install versions, including 1.3.33 and 2.0.54.

And, yes, I tried FAQ, google and the rest.

After now more than 12 hours trying to install just ANY version of Apache all I
get is stuff essentially boiling done to:

=== Logging started: 10/5/2005  2:04:10 ===
AppSearch: Property: EXISTING_APACHE_SERVICE_PATH, Signature: ExistingApacheService
=== Logging stopped: 10/5/2005  2:04:22 ===


THUS:

1) Any idea on the reason and a work around ?

2) I tried a /a option in the installer, so I do get the files, the system32
directory and a remaining installer file .msi  Now, I do get the SAME error
message when clicking the .msi but maybe there is a possibility of a manual
installation - but for this I should know the registry and COM stuff of which,
as a Linux guru, I have no idea at all.

Would be VERY happy for a good idea sent to cap@informatik.uni-rostock.de

Here a full error log (one of a dozend I produced)

=== Verbose logging started: 10/5/2005  1:29:25  Build type: SHIP UNICODE
2.00.2600.1106  Calling process: C:\WINDOWS\system32\msiexec.exe ===

(In reply to comment #0)
> I had Apache 2.0.54 installed and realized this would pose problems with Twiki.
> So I uninstalled the otherwise working 2.0.54 plus ssl and tried to install
1.3.33.
> 
> Since this time I am no longer able to install just ANY version of Apache.
> 

I have 2.0.51 installed and working on Windows XP Home.  I try to install 2.0.55
and it says first I must uninstall 2.0.51, which I do.  Then when I try to
install 2.0.55 it immediately throws a message saying the installer has been
interrupted.

Reinstalling 2.0.51 presents no problems.  

Anybody know how to resolve this?
creator: m.piff@btinternet.com

text:
It dies deep in here...
Action start 1:29:25: ResolveServerName.
MSI (c) (AC:08): Creating MSIHANDLE (1) of type 790542 for thread 1544
Action ended 1:29:34: ResolveServerName. Return value 3.
MSI (c) (AC:08): Doing action: SetupCompleteError
Action start 1:29:34: SetupCompleteError.
Action 1:29:34: SetupCompleteError. Dialog created

Please retest httpd 2.2.6 and let us know if the problem remains, however
you must ensure your networking is configured.  httpd isn't prepared to
continue if it can't decipher a network on your machine.  This might mean
you need your dial-up connection 'alive' so to speak during the install.
creator: wrowe@apache.org

text:
Marking fixed for 2.2.7 (2.0.62) as we've made a number of improvements
and fixes to the installer modules, and better diagnostics which should
appear in the event of failure with these releases in the coming week.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
